str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead, carry, take away; met: To be led astray, seduced. From apo and ago; to take off.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Caiaphas, Jewish high priest. Of Chaldee origin; the dell; Caiaphas, an Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
